core.menu: Open menu to access navigation options
core.are_you_sure: Are you sure? This action is irreversible.

canisters.cycles_description: Cycles are the unit of payment for operating your smart contracts. You can top-up (recharge) your {0} by converting ICP to cycles.
canisters.upgrade_validating: Validating if an upgrade is needed...
canisters.upgrade_description: Your {0} will be upgraded to version v{1}.
canisters.upgrade_breaking_change: The upgrade may contain some breaking changes. Please read the release notes carefully before continuing.
canisters.more_upgrade: After this upgrade, there will be {0} more upgrades available.
canisters.upgrade_note: There is a total of {0} upgrades available for your {1}. Upgrades should be executed one after the other, starting with the lower version number and moving upward. This process will guide you by upgrading to the next compatible version. Repeat the process until your {2} is up-to-date.
canisters.upgrade_confirm: Your {0} appears to be an extended build. Upgrading to the stock version will remove any custom features you have developed. Are you sure you want to continue?
canisters.top_up_info: Your current wallet balance is {0} ICP, and network fees for topping up are {1} ICP.
canisters.top_up_mission_control_done: Your mission control center has been topped-up.
canisters.edit_settings_segment: Update the settings of your {0} using the form below. Please note that any changes made will impact its runtime behavior.
canisters.upgrade_sha: Your {0} code will be upgraded with the wasm {1}.
canisters.confirm_upgrade_with_backup: We'll automatically create a backup of your current code before proceeding. Would you like to continue with the upgrade?
canisters.confirm_upgrade_without_backup: No backup will be created. Would you like to proceed with the upgrade?
canisters.upgrade_done: Your {0} has been has been successfully upgraded to version {1}.
canisters.delete_explanation: Cycles are necessary to delete the {0}, but the Internet Computer doesn't specify the exact amount required for this operation. Therefore, we recommend retaining 0.5 T Cycles on your {1} for this purpose.
canisters.delete_customization: You have the flexibility to modify this value if needed. Your current {0} balance is {1} T Cycles. Any remaining cycles will be transferred to your mission control.
canisters.delete_custom_domain: To delete a satellite, you should first remove its custom domain. This ensures that no leftovers are retained in the boundary nodes configuration, in case you intend to reuse the domain name in the future.
canisters.cycles_to_transfer: {0} T Cycles will be transferred to your mission control.
canisters.delete_info: Do you want to delete your {0}? This action is irreversible.
canisters.stop_info: Do you want to stop your {0}?
canisters.stop_forewords: Stopping the {0} will prevent any further interactions with it.
canisters.stop_explanation: Please note that a stopped {0} continues to consume Cycles for the memory it occupies, including any remaining outstanding responses, until the cycle balance reaches 0. After that, it will be deleted.
canisters.stop_error: Additionally, be aware that stopping the {0} may result in error messages being displayed in the console.
canisters.start_info: Do you want to resume your {0}?
canisters.detach_explanation: Detaching this {0} will remove it from your mission control list. It will continue to function if it's active, or be forgotten if it's inactive and won't appear in the console anymore.
canisters.detach_info: Do you want to detach your {0}?
canisters.transfer_cycles_description: You can manage your Cycles by moving them between your satellite, mission control, and analytics, ensuring your resources are where you need them most.
canisters.your_balance: Your current {0} balance is {1} T Cycles.
canisters.cycles_will_remain: {0} T Cycles will remain on your {1}.
canisters.warning_mission_control_low_cycles: Your mission control center is running low on cycles.
canisters.warning_satellite_low_cycles: Your satellite is running low on cycles.
canisters.warning_orbiter_low_cycles: Your orbiter is running low on cycles.
canisters.warning_satellite_heap_memory: Your satellite heap memory is approaching 1 GB.
canisters.warning_orbiter_heap_memory: Your orbiter heap memory is approaching 1 GB.
canisters.warning_indicator: Warning: This module requires your attention. Either stopping or running low on cycles.
canisters.settings_updated_text: The settings of your {0} have been updated.
canisters.no_update_required: No settings have been modified, so the settings do not need to be updated.
canisters.create_backup_info: Creates a copy of your {0}'s current state for safe restoration after updates or changes.
canisters.restore_backup_info: Restores your {0} to its previous state from {1}, using the backup {2}.
canisters.create_backup_warning: Only one backup is supported at a time; creating a new backup will replace the existing one.
canisters.restore_backup_warning: Restoring a backup will permanently overwrite the current state. This action is irreversible. Proceed with caution.
canisters.no_backup: There is currently no backup for this {0}.
canisters.backup_created: The backup for your {0} was created.
canisters.backup_restored: The backup for your {0} was restored.
canisters.delete_snapshot_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete the backup {0} of your {1}?

sign_in.future: Sign in to build your Web3 future.

satellites.title: Satellites
satellites.description: A satellite is a Web3 container for your project. It provides features like a simple key pair store, file storage, hosting, and authentication.
satellites.name: Name
satellites.enter_name: Enter a name for your satellite
satellites.edit_name: Edit the name of your satellite
satellites.create_satellite_price: Starting a new satellite requires {0} ICP. Your current wallet balance is {1} ICP.

wallet.title: Wallet
wallet.transfer_icp_info: Find more information about transferring funds to your wallet in the
wallet.transfer_to_account_identifier: You can buy or receive ICP using its account identifier
wallet.export_info: This process exports the displayed transactions to a CSV file. Shall we proceed?
wallet.send_information: Send tokens securely to any address. Your wallet currently holds {0} ICP.
wallet.review_and_confirm: Review the details below and confirm to proceed with your transaction.
wallet.icp_on_its_way: Your ICP is on its way!
wallet.wallet_approve: Approve the transaction in your OISY wallet...
wallet.wallet_missing_account: No account available to request the transaction. Have you connected your wallet?
wallet.balance_not_loaded: Please wait, your balance is not yet loaded.
wallet.balance_zero: Your balance is zero. Get some tokens to start sending.
wallet.wallet_upgrade: Please upgrade your wallet to enable the sending feature.

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.not_signed_in: You are not signed in. Please sign in to continue.
authentication.session_expired: You have been logged out because your session has expired.
authentication.edit_configuration: Update the configuration of your authentication using the form below.
authentication.main_domain_warn: You are about to change your main domain. Please ensure this is the desired action, as all existing users will no longer be recognized by your app.

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.empty: Juno provides simple, performant, and open-source web analytics that do not use cookies. It aggregates anonymous data within smart contracts and respects the privacy of your dapps and website visitors.
analytics.error_msg: An error occurred while processing the analytics for the selected filters. Please refine to try again.
analytics.description: Get analytics to measure and analyse how users engage with your apps.
analytics.create_orbiter_price: Starting with the analytics requires {0} ICP. Your current wallet balance is {1} ICP.
analytics.configuration_description: Select the Satellites you would like to track analytics for.

hosting.title: Hosting
hosting.success: Your custom domain has been configured.
hosting.add_records: Add records below to your DNS provider to configure and verify you own {0}. Do not delete any records as long as you use the domain.
hosting.dns_notes: You might have to adjust above records for your domain provider. Find more information in the documentation.
hosting.before_continuing: Before continuing, the records must be removed from your DNS provider.
hosting.delete_auth_domain_warning: This domain is the primary domain for all user sign-ins.
hosting.description: Enter the exact domain name you want people to see when they visit your satellite. It can be a domain (yourdomain.com) or a subdomain (app.yourdomain.com).
hosting.skip_delete_domain: Skip custom domain deletion in Boundary Nodes
hosting.set_auth_domain_question:
Would you like to use {0} as the main domain for all user sign-ins?

This setting, also known as "derivation origin", ensures that users are recognized on your app, regardless of whether they use the default URL or any other custom domain you might configure later.

For example, a user signing on at {1} will receive the same identifier (principal) as when signing on at {2}.

cli.title: Juno CLI Authentication
cli.sign_in: Sign in to set up your terminal for interacting with your mission control, satellite(s) and analytics.
cli.add: Please confirm the modules that will be controlled:
cli.profile_info: Providing a profile name, if desired, can help you easily identify the controller in future sessions.

errors.upgrade_requires_iterative_version: There may have been breaking changes between your {0} v{1} and selected version {2}. Please upgrade iteratively.
errors.top_up_error: Error while topping up the module.

errors.analytics_tracked_events_export: Unexpected error(s) while exporting the tracked events.

document.delete_all: You are about to delete all documents in the collection.
document.upload_description: To create a document to the collection {0}, select a JSON file for the data, specify a key, and optionally provide a description. You will be the owner, i.e. the user currently signed into the console.
document.replace_description: To overwrite the document's data in the collection {0}, upload a new JSON file.

admin.mission_control_new_version: A new version of your mission control is available! Upgrade it either interactively or through the CLI.
admin.satellite_new_version: A new version of your satellite is available! Upgrade it either interactively or through the CLI.
admin.orbiter_new_version: A new version of your orbiter is available! Upgrade it either interactively or through the CLI.

controllers.title: Controllers
controllers.no_delete: Juno cannot operate without your current signed-in identity and your mission control set as controllers. These settings cannot be edited through the console.
controllers.more_delete: However, you can edit or delete additional controllers that you may have added for non-interactive environments.
controllers.add_intro: Grant administrative or read-write permissions to a controller.
controllers.controller_generated_text: A controller has been generated. Please find below the details.

collections.title: Collections
collections.max_capacity_placeholder: Max number of documents within the collection
collections.rate_limit_placeholder: A limit on writes and deletes per minute
collections.empty_private: Your collection {0} read permission is set to private.
collections.none: No collection is defined. You can start a new one in the tab

users.empty: No registered users at the moment.

monitoring.title: Monitoring
monitoring.introduction: Ensure your modules always have enough cycles to operate by automatically tracking their levels and topping them up when needed. Enable auto-refill to avoid downtime and keep your projects running smoothly.
monitoring.create_info: Select the modules for which auto-refill will periodically ensure sufficient cycles.
monitoring.stop_info: Select the modules for which monitoring should be stopped.
monitoring.threshold_info: Define how many remaining cycles should trigger a top-up and the amount to add.
monitoring.threshold_info_mission_control: Define how many remaining cycles should trigger a top-up and the amount to add for your mission control.
monitoring.review_info: Review your strategy before applying them to ensure your modules and Mission Control stay topped up and operational.
monitoring.review_stop_info: Review the selected modules whose monitoring will be stopped.
monitoring.review_stop_mission_control: Once those modules are stopped, the process will also attempt to stop monitoring your Mission Control.
monitoring.review_mission_control_remain_monitored: Your Mission Control will remain monitored.
monitoring.no_mission_control_strategy: Since Mission Control manages the cycles and ICP required to top up your modules, it also needs an auto-refill strategy to ensure uninterrupted operations.
monitoring.no_mission_control_strategy_question: Do you want to use the same strategy for it?
monitoring.mission_control_existing_strategy: Your mission control is already monitored with a strategy set to a {0} T Cycle threshold and a {1} TCycle top-up.
monitoring.mission_control_existing_strategy_questi: Do you want to keep those parameters to continue monitoring it?
monitoring.min_cycles_not_defined: The remaining TCycle threshold must be provided.
monitoring.fund_cycles_not_defined: The top-up amount must be provided.
monitoring.warning_advice: Go to the Monitoring section to enable it and ensure sufficient cycles for your modules.
monitoring.stop_monitoring_question: Do you want to stop monitoring your Mission Control as well?
monitoring.stop_monitoring_note: Important Note: it can only be stopped if all your modules are about to stop being monitored or if none are still monitored.
monitoring.strategy_for_modules: This auto-refill strategy will be suggested as the default for monitoring newly created modules.
monitoring.auto_refill_strategy: Top-up {0}T Cycles if the remaining threshold falls below {1}
monitoring.receive_email: Do you want to receive email notifications when a module is refilled? Enter your email below to enable notifications or leave it blank if you prefer no notifications.
monitoring.choose_method: Choose how you'd like to configure auto-refill:
monitoring.basic_description: Predefined values to quickly set up auto-refill.
monitoring.custom_description: Define your own thresholds and top-up amounts.
monitoring.default_description: Use your previously saved default strategy.

examples.tutorial_docker_description: Run a Satellite in a Docker sandbox.

resources.resources_description: View a collection of sample code, applications, and microservices build with Juno
